titleStmt.title: A replie vnto a certaine libell, latelie set foorth by Fa: Parsons, in the name of vnited priests, intituled, A manifestation of the great folly and bad spirit, of certaine in England, calling themselues seculer priestes VVith an addition of a table of such vncharitable words and phrases, as by him are vttered in the said treatise, aswell against our parsons, as our bookes, actions, and proceedings.
titleStmt.author: Clark, William, d. 1603.

titleStmt.title: A replie vnto a certaine libell, latelie set foorth by Fa: Parsons, in the name of vnited priests, intituled, A manifestation of the great folly and bad spirit, of certaine in England, calling themselues seculer priestes VVith an addition of a table of such vncharitable words and phrases, as by him are vttered in the said treatise, aswell against our parsons, as our bookes, actions, and proceedings.
titleStmt.author: Clark, William, d. 1603.
Barneby, Francis. aut
Clarionet, William, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J. Roberts] Iustice, et innocentiæ permissu,

notesStmt.note: Preface signed: VV.C., i.e. William Clark, assisted by Francis Barneby.
A reply to: Parsons, Robert. A manifestation of the great folly of certayne in England calling themselves secular priestes.
Printer's name and place of publication from STC.
Running title reads: A reply to Fa: Parsons libell.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
